description._content: Photographer: Unknown, Non-Indian Subject: George Gustav Heye (GGH), Non-Indian, 1874-1957 Date Created: 1918 Catalog Number: P11608 Format: Albumen print Dimensions: 3.25 x 4 in. Collection History: Documentation of MAI expeditions and excavations and those funded by George Heye before the creation of the Museum often includes photographs of camp life and expedition members. Description: View of totem pole standing in a cleared area with a stockade (burial area?) with spindly trees and woods beyond. George Gustav Heye is posed at the base of the totem pole Place: Campbell River; Comox-Strathcona Regional District; British Columbia; Canada Archipelago: Vancouver Island Group Island Name: Vancouver Island Culture/People: Kwakwaka'wakw (Kwakiutl),Non-Indian Culture Hierarchy: Central Northwest Coast>Kwakwaka'wakw (Kwakiutl) See more items in: Photographic Collections Persistent URL:http://www.americanindian.si.edu/searchcollections/item.aspx?irn=314156 Repository:National Museum of the American Indian View more collections from the Smithsonian Institution.
